body.p: Paragraph 70 requires an entity to attribute benefits on a straight‑line basis if an employee’s service in later years will lead to a materially higher level of benefit than in earlier years. If a benefit formula is expressed as a constant proportion of current salary, some believe that expected future salary increases are not included in determining whether the benefit formula allocates a higher level of benefit in later years.
